Description: Typical range for Nd:YAG laser cleaning of silicates like serpentine to remove contaminants without substrate ablation; starting at 100W for light contamination. Max avoids thermal damage given serpentine's low thermal conductivity (~2 W/m·K). Source: General manufacturer specs (e.g., IPG Photonics systems for stone cleaning) and studies on mineral ablation (e.g., Paljk et al., J. Cult. Herit., 2010).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Serpentine mineral absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise Serpentine surface cleaning
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient ablation of Serpentine layers
Optimal scanning speed for efficient Serpentine removal
Recommended number of passes for complete Serpentine removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform Serpentine cleaning
